name: 2-phenylimidazole
Reason: 2-phenylimidazole has a melting point that we can analyze by considering its structural components. The basic unit for comparison is imidazole, which has a melting point of -15.5 degrees Celsius. The phenyl groups (c1ccc(cc1)c2) add rigidity and molecular weight, contributing approximately +30 to +50 degrees Celsius. The imidazole ring itself also contributes to the melting point due to its rigidity and potential hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +20 to +30 degrees Celsius. The presence of two phenyl groups can increase the melting point due to the enhancement of π-π interactions and overall molecular rigidity. Each phenyl group may contribute around +30 to +50°C.
